alert.note: Alert for Northern Arctic Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 14 at 3:05PM AKST until January 15 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Northern Arctic Coast. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills as low as 40 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel extremely difficult. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
